Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Obama "refused" to order the White House to be lit in blue to honor fallen police officers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the statement that President Obama "refused" to honor fallen police officers in this specific way.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that lighting the White House in blue is the only way to honor fallen police officers, without considering other ways in which President Obama may have honored them.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that President Obama did not refuse to honor fallen police officers, as he took other actions such as flying flags at half-staff.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Obama did not specifically refuse to light up the White House in blue, as there is no evidence to support this claim.
